thread.title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger won't have shouted at his players, says Martin Keown | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger won't have shouted at his players, says Martin Keown | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Arsene Wenger won't have shouted at his players, says Martin Keown | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 3:29 pm Arsene Wenger’s side put in an awful display in Munich (Picture: Getty) 
Arsene Wenger won’t have said anything to his Arsenal players after their 5-1 defeat to Bayern Munich last night, according to former Gunners defender Martin Keown. 
The Frenchman saw his side humiliated at the Allianz Arena in a spectacular second-half collapse, but Keown says it is not his policy to lay into his players in the dressing room. Wenger is not one to lay into his players (Picture: Getty) 
Keown played under Wenger for eight seasons at Arsenal, and has explained why his old boss isn’t one to rush into giving his post-match assessment. 
‘He will not speak after a game. His philosophy is that speaking in the immediate aftermath can only do harm — especially when things go very wrong,’ Keown told the Daily Mail. To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video
